intro: Corpuscularia cymbiformis, commonly known as the Cape carnation, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink, red, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its adaptability to arid conditions and ornamental appeal contribute to its horticultural value.
